review_title: Bellwoods Community Centre, supportive housing sector
pros: a very busy environment, many very talented employees
cons: there is not much opportunity for advancement, management positions are usually filled by outside candidates

review_title: Awesome place for patients and staff
pros: Amazing team dedicated to the patients they serve
cons: lots of complex patients but rewarding work

pros: There are no pros to this job I need it because I have to pay for my children but I have to be honest and tell you what is going on here. 300 Shaw Street Toronto.
cons: My colleagues are smoking pot and don't give a crap about people with disabilities that need their help. I've seen it we get treated like slaves  and my colleagues don't care about anyone who is disabled in the facility on Shaw and Dundas. They could be hungry for food and my colleagues don't care about feeding them they call it Independent Living but everybody in here cannot manage on their own how is that Independent Living everyone in here should be in a nursing home or long-term care home but managed me and my colleagues don't care what the human life it is very sad.

job_title: Administrative Support Clerk in Toronto, ON
pros: Assisting physically disabled adults with day-to-day tasks
cons: Due to the accoustics of where the main office is located, it can get very loud.

pros: Great place to work and study
